title: Add separate pre-commit job for spotless validation
body:
We heard feedback that many CI test regressions were spotless failures. Primarily this is caused when contributors will make small changes to incorporate reviewer feedback, and then merge right away. This may seem safe if the change has no semantic differences, but it can still break source formatting. The goal is to get a faster signal for spotless.

------------------------

Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily:

 - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue.
 - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf).

It will help us expedite review of your Pull Request if you tag someone (e.g. `@username`) to look at it.

title: [BEAM-3612] Add a benchmark for method invocation methods.
body:
With the Go SDK's necessary default use of reflection to achieve more idiomatic user code, it's up to the framework to reduce this overhead as much as possible. This benchmark illustrates the various methods available to the Go SDK and informs work I've been doing on [BEAM-3612].

Having properly generated type assertion shims at present represents a reduction of around ~400ns per function invocation. As mentioned in the JIRA, I've got a tool I've been working on to make generating these shims easier.

Further, this reveals there's a way to change how we handle *method* invocation which is relevant for Structural DoFns. The way we use a reflect.Value.Interface() call to get to back to an indirect interface{} version of the method, we typically go through the "Implicit Receiver" route, so that the receiver we're operating on (the Structural DoFn with the associated state) is implicitly cached and instated by the reflection code when we call it. This adds ~180ns overhead (on my machine) compared to the the Explicit Receiver version.

The tricky part here is that moving to Explicit Receivers requires a minor overhaul through the beam function handling code, to properly mark the receiver parameter for the type checking phase. This is better accomplished after we have *tools* to re-generate type assertion shims for the SDK, if we're doing it at all.

Finally, by having arity Explicit invocation of the shims reduces overhead by another 30ns. This is probably something that can be generated one off (with the above concession to the Explicit Receiver approach) to get a base set of combinatorial values. However, the extra overhead of a arity specialized invoker might be more than the 30ns cost of allocating & extracting the values from the slice, so this should be more specifically benchmarked in context of invoking for ParDos.



------------------------

Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily:

 - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue.
 - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf).

It will help us expedite review of your Pull Request if you tag someone (e.g. `@username`) to look at it.

title: [BEAM-5918] Add Cast transform for Rows
body:
Casts rows from one schema, into another. Implements:
- widening values (e.g., int -> long), to be extended with more conversions
- narrowwing (e.g., int -> short), to be extended with more conversions
- ignoring nullability (nullable=true -> nullable=false)
- weakening nullability (nullable=false -> nullable=true)
- projection (Schema(a: Int32, b: Int32) -> Schema(a: Int32))

It would be very useful for Row-based IO-s, for instance, BeamBigQueryTable can be implemented with org.apache.beam.sdk.schemas.utils.AvroUtils and Cast, and this will make it more flexible, now it's very restrictive to the schema.

Another example is reading AVRO GenericRecord as user-provided POJO, [BEAM-5807](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-5807).

I want to get an initial portion of feedback before polishing Javadoc, API, etc.

title: [BEAM-5913] Re-enable parallel builds for Java Jenkins jobs
body:
This re-enables parallel builds for Java jobs where it was disabled.

Recent context:

 - The root cause of parallel build failures was identified and fixed in #6864 
 - Parallel tests were re-enabled, but exposed an existing bug in Dataflow Worker tests: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-5908
 - The bug was reproduced without parallel builds in #6878 
 - The bug was fixed in #6877 

We should be able to re-enable them, since we know we have fixed the one failure that occurred last time.

title: Flesh out the roll-forward case in postcommit policy
body:
This adds more detail to how to roll forward after a roll back, breaking it down into common cases.

The phrasing on the website implies that a postcommit failure is necessarily a bug in the code that caused the failure. This is only one of three common scenarios. We don't want people to think the policy does not apply to their change just because the failure was not a bug in their change.

http://apache-beam-website-pull-requests.storage.googleapis.com/6873/contribute/postcommits-policies/index.html

------------------------

title: Link to Timely Processing blog post in Programming Guide
body:
The Programming Guide currently discusses the `@OnTimer` annotation, but otherwise doesn't explain concepts about timers. Until we add a full explanation of timers ([BEAM-2472](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-2472)), this connects users to a resource they otherwise would not be likely to discover.

title: [BEAM-5908] Revert "[BEAM-5887] Fix classifier for unshaded tests"
body:
This reverts commit 53753c8afb0f574b8c6fdec3bfe04236588ce05a and also re-disables parallel builds. One of them is almost certainly the culprit.

It appears to cause failures in the non-portable Dataflow worker running
portability tests.

title: [BEAM-5886] Fix incorrectly formulated condition in checkState method
body:
The suites failed because 0 counters of the same name were created.
I extended the error message to include a more descriptive information
about this.

Other than that a test for multiple counters with the same name was
deleted. The reason it passed was because 0 counters were created
(false-positive). As it turned out it is nontrivial to create a test
that creates two metrics of the same name and type so I skipped this
for now.


------------------------

title: [BEAM-5875] Revert "[BEAM-5716] Extract MetricReader class, test it and use in Nexmark
body:
This reverts commit 69730fc4c66adba7cc3ea10866b340046dc5f87e.

There is some shading/dependency issue so the class is not found at runtime. It may be that the shading set up for the new test utils is broken all around, but this anyhow restores the Nexmark signal.

I have verified offline that running the benchmarks at head fails for all runners, and succeeds for the direct runner with this change.

title: [BEAM-5866] Fix `Row#equals`
body:
This pull request defines two properties that any `Coder` implementation should satisfy. There are two coders that don't properly implement `structuralValue`: `MapCoder` and `RowCoder`.

`RowCoder#consistentWithEquals` is defined as always true. It isn't true in case schema has field of type `Map<BYTES, ?>`. However, such field type makes little sense. One of the ways to fix it would be to reject such schemas. For now, this test is ignored.

title: [BEAM-5036] Optimize the FileBasedSink WriteOperation.moveToOutput()
body:
This changes 2 things:

  1. Makes the rename() in HDFS overwrite existing files which is necessary as it is the only FS which throws on this scenario currently.
  2. Changes the WriteOperation.moveToOutput() to do a `rename` instead of a "copy and delete". GCS and S3 implement a rename() as a copy and delete so this does not change behaviour when using those FS. It will change behaviour when using a LocalFileSystem to an atomic move instead of a copy/delete.

This PR brings necessary performance improvements for HDFS users (e.g. 102 minutes down to 42 minutes for rewriting 1.5TB avro. See [@dev discussion](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/b904779aefec1b6d01d28a492f626075de009a71587e1b9df3aa0f2b@%3Cdev.beam.apache.org%3E)  )

title: [BEAM-5853] Possible fix in RemoteGrpcPortWriteOperation
body:
I'm not sure whether this is a right fix but seems like it works for me to stop the stuckness. 
R: @robertwb, @lukecwik 
More information:
For the stuck fnapi worker pipeline, it gets stuck at [maybeWait](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/master/runners/google-cloud-dataflow-java/worker/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/dataflow/worker/fn/data/RemoteGrpcPortWriteOperation.java#L165), and keeps evaluating [shouldWait](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/master/runners/google-cloud-dataflow-java/worker/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/dataflow/worker/fn/data/RemoteGrpcPortWriteOperation.java#L111). I found, the numProcessed should be -1 since it's not supported and the targetElementsSent should be set to MAX. But the [following else block](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/master/runners/google-cloud-dataflow-java/worker/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/dataflow/worker/fn/data/RemoteGrpcPortWriteOperation.java#L129) will override this logic again, which causes this loop forever.

title: [BEAM-5724] Generalize flink executable context to allow more than 1 worker process per task manager
body:
By default, beam will create a single python sdk worker per Flink taskmanager / job, and #6524 added an option (`--sdk-worker-parallelism stage`) that would instead create one python worker per Flink stage. However in our experience this leads to far too many python processes (possibly thousands), as flink may run many stages in a single task slot.

This PR introduces an alternate approach to managing sdk worker concurrency. Basically, we know that our box has some capacity (roughly correlated to number of CPU cores) and we'd like to use as much as possible for executing our worker code, while not suffering the overhead of too many worker processes.

With this PR, `--sdk-worker-parallelism` now takes the number of processes to run per TM. By default this is 1 (retaining the existing behavior). There's also an "auto" value of 0 that will set it to `number of cores - 1`, which is likely what most streaming users would want. As stages are constructed, we will create new StageContexts until we have `--sdk-worker-parallelism` of them, then we round-robin assign new stages to the existing contexts.

cc @tweise 

------------------------

title: Refactor Python integration test build script
body:
Refactor Python PostCommit build scripts to make testing easier to config and run:

- Deprecate `script/run_postcommit.sh`, which has many hacks to cover corner cases and is hard to understand/use/maintain. Use [`script/run_integration_test.sh`](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/master/sdks/python/scripts/run_integration_test.sh) instead. The new script does exactly same thing but has better documentations and more command line flags support, which can be used by Jenkins or manually on local machine.
- Refactor Python Gradle tasks that run integration tests in PostCommit jobs. The purpose is to keep test specific configs in `build.gradle`. We should be able to run any set of integration tests (ITs, ValidatesRunner tests on any runner) by building necessary test/pipeline options in Gradle tasks and then run with `script/run_integration_test.sh`.
- Add comment blocks in `build.gradle`.

Also increase timeout of each python execution to 4500s (using nose flag `--process-timeout`).

body:
Fix Go dataflow runner --worker_harness_container_image flag, currently ignored.

+R: @angoenka PTAL, this flag appears to have been disconnected in https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/6441

When not set it uses the default:

        if *image == "" {

        }

title: [BEAM-5703]Migrate py integration test to using customized worker jar
body:
Py code change is in PR#6680. 

Passed on done following tests: 

**[Test1 passed by succeeding ]** ./gradlew validatesRunnerStreamingTests passed on local machine. 

**[Test2 passed by succeeding]** the default streaming+dataflowRunner case, only the shell script. 

./scripts/run_postcommit.sh ValidatesRunner,'!sickbay-streaming' streaming TestDataflowRunner $GCS_LOCATION $PROJECT \
../../runners/google-cloud-dataflow-java/worker/build/libs/beam-runners-google-cloud-dataflow-java-fn-api-worker-2.9.0-SNAPSHOT.jar

**[Test 3. passed by succeeding]** TestDirectRunner. Not affected. 

./scripts/run_postcommit.sh IT streaming TestDirectRunner $GCS_LOCATION  $PROJECT

**[Test 4. Passed by validation failure]** Specified ‘streaming’ and TestDataFlow, but no jar file provided.
 ./scripts/run_postcommit.sh ValidatesRunner,'!sickbay-streaming' streaming TestDataflowRunner $GCS_LOCATION $PROJECT


**[Test 5. Passed by timeOut failure]** Pass a corrupted artifact to worker. Test time out. 
./scripts/run_postcommit.sh ValidatesRunner,'!sickbay-streaming' streaming TestDataflowRunner gs://test-${USER} $PROJECT ./FakeJar.txt

title: [BEAM-4431] Add "Edit on Github" button to website
body:
Adds "Edit on Github" button to website, at the top right, to the right of the feather dropdown.
This opens the source .md file on the master branch in the github editor.
Prompts for github login if not logged in.
If you don't have access to the beam repo, it uses your fork.
You can then create a pull request.
The image on the website is the same image used on the Apache maven site.

title: [BEAM-5304] Small improvements to ULR Job Server run command.
body:
Adding a new property to the run command for the ULR Job Server to set the level for vendor logs.

------------------------

Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily:

 - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue.
 - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf).

It will help us expedite review of your Pull Request if you tag someone (e.g. `@username`) to look at it.
